title: How to Make Dairy Free Gluten Free Chocolate Munchies

steps.headline: Heat the peanut butter in a measuring cup, using the microwave.
steps.description: Heat it for about 15 seconds, just to warm it up.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate chips and stir together for a bit.
Put back in the microwave for 10 seconds.
steps.description: Stir it some more. There should be very few chocolate pieces by now.

steps.headline: If necessary, put it in for 10 seconds more.
steps.description: Stir it until all of the chocolate is mixed in with the peanut butter.

steps.headline: Start pouring, slowly and carefully, into the ice cube tray(s).Raise the tray about 4 inches (10cm) or so, and then drop it onto the surface.
steps.description: Do this several times, to shift any air bubbles out.

steps.headline: Be sure that you have a flat, level surface.
Refrigerate.
steps.description: You will want to have it colder than room temperature and by chilling it, it will set faster.

steps.headline: Once set, gently push on the back of the mold.
steps.description: It helps the chocolate to  pop out.

text: Melting the Ingredients Heat the peanut butter in a measuring cup, using the microwave. Heat it for about 15 seconds, just to warm it up. Add the chocolate chips and stir together for a bit.  Put back in the microwave for 10 seconds. Stir it some more. There should be very few chocolate pieces by now. If necessary, put it in for 10 seconds more. Stir it until all of the chocolate is mixed in with the peanut butter. Molding the Munchies Start pouring, slowly and carefully, into the ice cube tray(s).Raise the tray about 4 inches (10cm) or so, and then drop it onto the surface. Do this several times, to shift any air bubbles out. Be sure that you have a flat, level surface.  Refrigerate. You will want to have it colder than room temperature and by chilling it, it will set faster. Once set, gently push on the back of the mold. It helps the chocolate to  pop out. Serve and enjoy.
